dialogues.text: Nibs. Nibs! No response. Peter leans forward, pulling the BLANKET bac reveal: the bed is empty. Peter reacts when--

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Peter! Peter JUMPS spinning around to see:

dialogues.speaker: NIBS

dialogues.speaker: NIBS
dialogues.text: I_thought you said Warwick was sleeping. We hear the THUMP again.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I don’t think that was Warwick.

dialogues.text: Maybe it was--

dialogues.speaker: RUN
dialogues.text: Before they can even comprehend what’s happening around t Peter and Nibs make a desperate run for their lives as--

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t look back! Just don’t look--

dialogues.speaker: NIBS
dialogues.text: Peter puts the brakes on, pivoting to the window, only to where Nibs went out-

OUTSIDE THE WINDOW-- BOOM! Peter lands hard on the wooden DECK of something. He frantically TEARS the hood off and eyes widen. PULL OUT to reveal: Peter is lying next to Nibs on the deck of a 160-FOOT, 32 GUN, HONEST TO GOODNESS 18th CENTURY, GALLEON-CLASS PIRAT SHIP -- somehow SUSPENDED IN MID-AIR and DOCKED in the re courtyard along the top floor of the Kensington Home. Peter’s head swivels right to see--

dialogues.speaker: PREPARED FOR THE JOURNEY BACK.
dialogues.text: His head swivels left to see--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATTACHED TO THE STERN OF THE SHIP, EXCEPT IT’S BELCHING A

dialogues.speaker: MATE SHOVEL WHITE ROCKS WITH AMBER-COLORED VEINS INTO IT.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE.
dialogues.text: ON PETER & NIBS-- lost in the shuffle, they scamper to hi behind a row of BARRELS.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're dreaming. This is a dream.

dialogues.speaker: NIBS
dialogues.text: We can’t be having the same dream, Peter! Peter pokes his head over the side of the barrels to see: Murphy securing the below deck hold, trapping the orphans

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: All in! ON PETER & NIBS-- at the ledge of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: NIBS
dialogues.text: We have to jump! We have to! Peter looks down at the drop and his face goes white. Sha his head.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: There’s got to be another way! ON TURK (40)-- Anatolian with the arms of a wrestler and eyes of a killer, stands at the wheel of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Sails up! Everybody hold tight! ANGLE ON THE FRONT OF THE KENSINGTON HOME-- from this van point, the ship is totally concealed. All seems calm when the ship slowly appears over the roof of the building, it sails rapidly rising.

dialogues.speaker: TURK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And away... Peter and Nibs prepare to jump back to the roof. TURK (CONT’D) We... Nibs JUMPS first, landing safely. Peter hesitates, just c bring himself to do it.

dialogues.speaker: NIBS
dialogues.text: Come on! He finally steels himself to LEAP as- the sails reach ful mast, catching a gust of winter wind.

dialogues.speaker: NIBS
dialogues.text: Peter!!! ON NIBS-- standing on the roof alone, helpless as he watc Peter and the ship sail away. As the ship flies past us, we catch its name for the firs time emblazoned on its bow: THE JOLLY ROGER. ON PETER-- as he sneaks a glimpse over the side to see: London rapidly disappearing into miniature beneath him. Peter begins hyperventilating. The first time we’ve seen truly panicking. Can’t catch his breath. He shuts his eye SUDDENLY-- the BARREL he has his back to is lifted up, revealing the hidden Peter to-

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: What are you doing up here?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Catching a spot of fresh air? Murphy’s tremendous hands reach out to pounce on Peter wh SFX -- a familiar AIR-RAID SIREN wails.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Man the guns, all of you! Murphy turns back to Peter -- only to realize Peter is go

dialogues.speaker: TURK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Murphy) I said all of you! Murphy hesitates, then gives up on Peter, races to his po

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A female OPERATOR (25) tears off a telegram, racing throu an office filled with desk after desk of other women seat at telegraphs. Our Operator jogs out of the filter room i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Corporal, sir!  Fuchs 10.9.13 18. A handsome CORPORAL (30) takes the telegram. Reads it, th

dialogues.speaker: CORPORAL
dialogues.text: Luftwaffe aircraft inbound!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We RACE along the port of the ship as CANNON AFTER CANNON rapidly poke out of the row of gun ports. ON DECK-- we watch CREWMEN race past a LARGE CRATE. We PU IN on the crate until we see a pair of eyes following the action from between the wood panels. INSIDE THE CRATE-- Peter hides, watching the commotion. T pirates hurry port and starboard, until’ a familiar AERON RUMBLE draws Peter’s attention aft to see-- A PAIR OF BRITISH RAF SPITFIRES INBOUND AT 240-PLUS MPH.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Incoming!!! Just as-- BRATATATAT! A HAIL OF GUNFIRE HITS THE DECK AS THIRD SPITFIRE STRAFES THE ROGER FROM ABOVE. The gunfire splits the box Peter’s standing in open, sudd exposing him -- again.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Oh, for heaven's sake. Everyone's too preoccupied to notice, though, as another of gunfire hits the deck. Peter DUCKS for cover.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Dive! DIVE! VWOOSH! THE ROGER ABRUPTLY NOSE DIVES AND WE’RE SUDDENLY

dialogues.speaker: HOLDING ON FOR DEAR LIFE.
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE SPITFIRE COCKPIT- the Pilot speaks into his ra

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Sir, the aircraft--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our CORPORAL and a cadre of COMMANDERS are huddled around radar station.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It-- it almost looks like a pirate ship. There’s a beat of silence.  Fuchs 10.9.13 19.

dialogues.speaker: CORPORAL
dialogues.text: Come again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Roger comes shooting through the twin peaks of London Tower Bridge followed by the Spitfires seconds later, zoo over the Thames, water spraying in their wake. ON PETER-- as he RACES starboard, desperately searching f any surface low enough to leap out onto. Peter hesitates, can’t bring himself to do it when-- the Roger BANKS hard left and Peter goes -— VWOOM! -- right O the ledge of the ship falling through the air until-- BAM GRABS onto SOMETHING, legs dangling in mid-air. BACK ON DECK-- Turk notices Peter first.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: We lost one! THERE! We see what Turk sees:

dialogues.speaker: THE CLOCK-FACE OF BIG BEN.
dialogues.text: Peter’s POV: a 300 foot plus sheer drop down to the groun

dialogues.speaker: TURK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come around! Let’s get him and get the hell out of here! BACK ON PETER-- his arms starting to slip. He’s not going make it. Suddenly-

dialogues.speaker: TURK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold on tight to something! We’re not coming back for you twice! Peter frowns, confused, as Turk races to help his crewmen ROTATE the masts. Peter's P.O.V. - the three spitfires are inbound from thr different angles, all racing toward the Roger. As the Spitfires near, Peter watches, mystified, as the c ROTATES and then -- using a CRANK —— TILT the sails horizontally until they’re ISG rigged at an angle off the port and starboard of the s ike makeshift sailcloth WINGS.

dialogues.speaker: TURK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take us up! Let’s get out of here!  Fuchs 10.9.13 20. And just as the Spitfire are about to converge on the Rog VWOOSH! The Roger SHOOTS UP VERTICALLY like a rocket.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Pull up! Pull up!

dialogues.speaker: AVOIDING A THREE-WAY MID-AIR COLLISION BY INCHES.
dialogues.text: BACK ON THE ROGER-- the Pirates are securing themselves t the deck with THICK ROPES as the ship rockets upward. PULL WIDE to see: a furious race to the stars as the RAF fighters pursue the Roger vertically into the sky. The Spitfires begin rattling violently as the air pressur and cold begin to tear them apart. FROM INSIDE THE COCKPIT—- we see the Roger in the Pilot’s cross-hairs; about to fire when SUDDENLY- the engine stal We WATCH as the Pilot’s Spitfire drops out of the sky and EJECTS to safety.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT 2
dialogues.text: The altitude! Pull back! The TWO SPITFIRES peel off as the Roger continues throttl skyward. Pilot 2 SLAMS his fist into the altimeter. PILOT 2 (CONT’D) Damnit! ON PETER-- as he searches for anything to hold onto and f a ROPE. He grabs it as-

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Hold on!!! The Roger breaks through the cloud cover and- SUDDENLY WE’RE IN ZERO-GRAVITY AS EVERYTHING NOT TIED DOW THE DECK, INCLUDING PETER, BRIEFLY LEVITATES, WEIGHTLESS.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTIAL OCEAN.
dialogues.text: ON PETER-- entranced, he REACHES out to a star so close i feels like he can grasp it. As he does, our ANGLE on the Roger ROTATES 180 degrees, s that up is down and down is u And just when Peter’s finge are about to make contact with that Star-  Fuchs 10.9.13 21. VWOOSH! Gravity KICKS BACK IN in the reverse direction, t ship PLUMMETING DOWNWARD into what we thought was night s Peter’s grip on the taut rope the only thing preventing h from hurtling off the deck into space.

dialogues.speaker: SLOWING ITS FALL.
dialogues.text: ON PETER-- as he stands, rubbing his eyes, to see the shi engulfed in a cloud cover so dense you can’t see a foot p the bow. The PIRATES lead the ORPHANS from below up onto the deck the Roger EMERGES out of the clouds to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: AN ISLAND AHEAD OF THEM UNLIKE ANYTHING WE HAVE EVER SEEN
dialogues.text: It’s a tropical dreamland. Lush green rainforest everywhe we look. Epic waterfalls. In the far distance, a mountain range that’s Tora Bora meets Everest. ON PETER-- as he and the other orphans stare at this stra magnificent place in abject wonder. When he hears a BUZZI noise and turns to see: A flock of FLYING FISH, their wings vibrating rapidly lik hummingbird’s, all moving in perfect harmony. In an insta VWOOM! The flock DIVES as one. Peter races to the edge of bow, to see the fish are diving into:

dialogues.speaker: SWIMMING AROUND INSIDE.
dialogues.text: The flying fish dive in and emerge with mouthfuls of smal fish. PULL WIDE TO REVEAL:

dialogues.speaker: TURK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (behind Peter) I wouldn’t think about diving in. ANGLE ON A FLOATING LAGOON BELOW-- we see the vague outli of a flying fish as it’s-- CHOMP! CONSUMED by a SILHOUETTED CREATURE that’s crocodil in shape, but dinosaur-like in scale, easily 14 feet and tons of pure, reptilian predator.

dialogues.speaker: TURK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Crocs.  Fuchs 10.9.13 22.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (eyes wide This is impossible...

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Nothing’s impossible here. ANGLE ON-- a SHEER CLIFF FACE pockmarked by tunnel openin looming over them as the Roger approaches.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Where is ‘here’?

dialogues.speaker: _. TURK
dialogues.text: (smiles) Home. The Roger, its sails returned to their vertical position, SAILS into one of the TUNNEL OPENINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s pitch black and silent but for the sound of water lapping at the tunnel’s sides. As the Roger moves deeper, though, our eyes adjust to see:

dialogues.speaker: JABBED INTO CREVICES IN THE STONE.
dialogues.text: The Roger continues on toward a light at_the end of the tunnel. As we reach the light, the tunnel passage opens u one side to reveal below:

dialogues.speaker: MINES OF EARTH, BUT ON AN INCOMPREHENSIBLE SCALE.
dialogues.text: Hundreds of LADDERS protrude out of these epic terrestria cavities. YOUNG SLAVES covered with thick MUD, their face barely recognizable as human, scale the ladders with heav loads on their backs. At the top of the craters, we see even YOUNGER SLAVES sif through the piles of dirt and rock carried out of the pit The brutal inhumanity of this work is a terrifying sight. Peter can’t believe what he’s seeing. He SWALLOWS hard. ON THE ROGER-- as it passes into another tunnel, suddenly The ship ZOOMS DOWN an incline, the water SPRAYING into o faces until it shoots out of the tunnel into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Roger SPITS out into a massive lagoon filled with DOZ OF SHIPS just like it;  Fuchs 10.9.13 23. Galleon upon Galleon, filled with wide eyed ORPHANS like ours, trying to figure out what’s going on and where the they are. SUDDENLY-- a SHADOW slowly moves over them. All look up t see--

dialogues.speaker: AN 18TH, CENTURY, 100-GUN, 200-FOOT SHIP OF THE LINE.
dialogues.text: ON THE SHIP-- as its bow passes over us we catch the name its side: QUEEN ANNE’S REVENGE. ON THE ORPHANS OF EVERY SHIP-- as the pirates PROD them t kneel toward the ship floating over them. Peter refuses.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I don’t bow to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Oh, you'll bow to him... ANGLE ON TWIN GLEAMING WUSHU HOOK SWORDS-- as they’re bot sheathed in rapid succession.

dialogues.speaker: TURK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He’s the pirate all pirates fear. ANGLE ON AN ICONIC FEATHERED PIRATE HAT-- as it’s retriev off a hat stand.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: The original nightmare. C/U -- on the eyes of someone evil...and cunning. We don’t yet see his face. We do see his immediately recognizable flowing CRIMSON COAT and the TWO SWORDS peek out from either side of it as he walks. BELOW ON THE ROGER-- Turk PUSHES little Peter to his knee

dialogues.speaker: TURK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The man they call- On the Captain as he turns to reveal the face of--

dialogues.speaker: TURK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Blackbeard. Who were you expecting? Meet: BLACKBEARD (42, mesmerizing features) waves to the kneeled children below, basking in their forced adulation -- their fear.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBEARD
dialogues.text: Hear me, you abandoned children of another world! Where you come from, you were the missing. The unwanted. The unloved. But not here. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBEARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here, you join orphans alike from every corner of the globe in a place where you never have to fear! Never have to want! Never have to be alone again! The way he speaks, it’s almost Svengali like. We can see orphans slowly falling under his spell as the Revenge dri over their heads.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBEARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here we will join together in these mines, hand in hand, as one, digging for the Dust that allows us to travel between your old world and your new one. The dust that will allow us to liberate more of your brothers, your sisters so never again do they have to suffer as you have suffered! We shall work, so that they -- like you now - - can be free! Blackbeard smiles, warmly -- genuinely.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBEARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Welcome. Welcome you lost souls, now found to a place we call... grandly) Neverland! And slowly, out of fear or hope, maybe both -- who knows these kids start to CHEER. And Blackbeard REVELS in it. ON PETER-- stone faced and more alone than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow a SEA OF ORPHANS as they’re herded through a na rocky passway into the mines as FEARSOME GUARDS watch ove them. ON PETER-- as a PICK-AXE is thrust into his hand by a GUA before he’s SHOVED forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C/U ON A PICK AXE AS-- THWACK! It SLAMS into granite.

dialogues.speaker: FOREMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: For those of you just joining us... Widen as we TRACK a FOREMAN (24), close-cropped hair, a f that might once have been sweet, as he moves down an endl row of YOUNG ORPHANS —- a tableau of bondage straight out Exodus - as they SLAM their axes into the rock.  Fuchs 10.9.13 25. FOREMAN (CONT’D My name’s Sam, Sam Smiegel, and it’s my unfortunate pleasure to wetcome you to the rest of your ife. We finally LAND on Peter as he STRAINS to lift the axe.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It’s pretty simple, really. You all here are diggers like me. And what we're looking for are these lovelies... The Foreman holds up one of those white rocks.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pixum. This is what fairy dust is made out of. The bones oF long dead fairies.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Fairies are-- they’re real?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Were. Past tense. There were millions of them, all over the island until the pirates hunted them into extinction.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (still in disbelief) But you mean actual fairies?

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN MINER
dialogues.text: Hey, new guy! RACK FOCUS to see a few miners over: a VETERAN MINER (mal late 20s), in the garb of a slave, but with the swagger - not to mention rugged good looks -- of Han Solo.

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN MINER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You just arrived here on a flying pirate ship. Real should be a very luid concept for you right now.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I was just curious is all.

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN MINER
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, next time you get curious, my advice? (smiles) Shut up and dig. The miner glares at Peter and goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Well, then -- any other questions? Peter shakes his head and gets to work. DISSOLVE TO:  Fuchs 10.9.13 26. SERIES OF SHOTS-- as we watch Peter SLAVING away in the mines. DIGGING, LIFTING heavy loads as the CAMP GUARDS wa over him and the other miners. A time lapse tableau of li in the camps. Finally land on-- Peter silhouetted against the sunset as he digs tirelessl into the night. Somehow the sunset looks different in Neverland. The sun itself seems physically bigger; the streaks of pinks and purples in the sky more brilliant. INT. MINERS’ CAMP - NIGHT C/U -- Peter’s hand is worn so raw it’s bloodied. Peter, seated at the edge of a cot, tears a piece of FABR off his shirt and WINCES as he begins to WRAP his wound. SFX -- the sound of METAL SHEARING AGAINST METAL. dialogues.speaker: VETERAN MINER
dialogues.text: Give me yours. The Vet is seated in the corner on a stool sharpening his axe. He doesn’t even look up at Peter. VETERAN MINER (CONT’D) Your axe. Give it to me. Peter hesitantly hands it over. VETERAN MINER (CONT’D) Your hand’s all messed up because your blade is blunted. You keep swinging like that you’re going to end up breaking your wrist. As the miner sharpens Peter’s blade using the hook:

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’m Peter, by the way. The miner just keeps sharpening the blade.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why do they want it so badly? The lust.

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN MINER
dialogues.text: What’d I tell you about asking so many questions? Rule number one of staying alive in these mines is keep your head down. You can’t trust anyone. Blackbeard has informants everywhere inside the camps. Rule number two, always listen to me. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN MINER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You break either of those, mark my words, this‘’ll end up being the shortest trip of your life. then The Dust is Neverland’s most precious natural resource. With it? You live forever. Never age, never die. Basically, the Fountain of Youth. That’s the reason they want it. It’s everything to them. They kill for it. We die for it. Happy? He SHOVES the ax back at Peter.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN MINER
dialogues.text: Don’t thank me. I don’t care about you. I care about us making our quota. If you can’t dig, we don’t eat. It’s that simple. Are we clear? Peter nods as the Vet STANDS and DISAPPEARS deeper into t camp. Peter watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter chops away, getting the hang of it when he notices Vet standing a few orphans down. ON THE VET-- shirtless and chopping like a machine.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. The Vet turns to see Peter standing there. Goes back to chopping.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say that if there’s ever anything I could do to repay you-

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN MINER
dialogues.text: You want to make it up to me? Stay away from me. Peter nods and goes back to chopping. The Vet eyes his proximity, annoyed, but just ignores him. Then- WE HEAR A YOUNG GIRL’S SCREAMS. Twenty feet away: a YOUNG SLAVE GIRL (16) is on the groun a CAMP GUARD (30, body by Bane) looms over her, WHIPPING ground at her feet, terrifying her. Peter, disturbed, starts to approach and the Vet grabs hi  Fuchs 10.9.13 28.

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN MINER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t. Getting involved is only going to turn bad into worse, trust me, I’ve seen it. THWACK! As the whip CRACKS into the ground next to the gi head. ON PETER-- his jaw clenches. Every instinct in his body telling him to do something. ON THE SLAVE GIRL’S FACE-- tears streaming as her eyes me Peter’s in the distance. Her eyes PLEADING with him. Help Peter has to turn away. The Vet nods.

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN MINER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright then. Maybe you’re not as dumb as you-- The Vet looks back and Peter is gone. He turns to see Pet halfway to the slave girl. VETERAN MINER (CONT’D) Nope -- even dumber. Damn it. Kid! ON THE SLAVE GIRL-- as she shields her face from the guar when we hear--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You're hurting her. The guard turns to see Peter standing behind him; looks a this little waif, confused.

dialogues.text: Did you say something? Slave.

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN MINER
dialogues.text: o: namteevgnane) t. he didn Excuse us-—

dialogues.text: I said you’re hurting her. The Camp Guard almost laughs. Who is this kid?

dialogues.text: Well, then, maybe youd like to havea word with the Captain about that? The both of you. Off Peter’s suddenly worried face-- EXT. QUEEN ANNE’S REVENGE - DAY THUMP! THUMP THUMP! dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: What's going on? The pirate behind him just stares back when suddenly the cheers ERUPT as--

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBEARD
dialogues.text: Hear me... Blackbeard steps onto the deck, waving to the cheering cr BLACKBEARD (CONT’D You brave heroes of Neverlan His voice ECHOES loudly in the mines as the cheers rise. Blackbeard smiles. BLACKBEARD (CONT’D Behold these traitors whose fates I entrust to your noble hands! ON PETER & THE VET-- as they and the other SLAVES are PRO out onto the PLANKS. Peter looks down and immediately loo ready to vomit.

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN MINER
dialogues.text: Still hate the rules now? Blackbeard strides toward the first plank, at the edge of which stands a YOUNG ASIAN TEEN.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBEARD
dialogues.text: This one was caught stealing from the grain stores! TWICE! Shall you have mercy?! (jeers from the crowd) Or not?! The crowd CHEERS and with that-- BOOM! The TEEN is shoved the plank, PLUMMETING to his death.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBEARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The people have spoken. Blackbeard moves on to the next kid. ON PETER-- he’s third in line. Not good. He eyes the seve hundred-story drop.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
